text.div:
DrugTierDefinition Extension

A description of the drug tiers used by the formulary and how those tiers implement copay and coinsurance amounts. Drug tiers do not have any inherent meaning that is consistent across all formularies. Rather, each tier is defined using this element.

name: DrugTierDefinition
title: Drug Tier Definition
description: A description of the drug tiers used by the formulary and how those tiers implement copay and coinsurance amounts. Drug tiers do not have any inherent meaning that is consistent across all formularies. Rather, each tier is defined using this element.

element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: A description of the drug tiers used by the formulary and how those tiers implement copay and coinsurance amounts. Drug tiers do not have any inherent meaning that is consistent across all formularies. Rather, each tier is defined using this element.
A code that describes the coverage status of a drug in a health plan (e.g., preferred generic, specialty, etc.)
A Boolean indication of whether this drug tier supports a mail order pharmacy option
Definition of the patients responsibility for a portion of the cost not covered by insurance for a particular pharmacy type within a drug tier
A code that describes the network (in/out) status of a pharmacy, the duration of supply, and whether this is a mail order pharmacy.
A standard, nominal fee charged for each prescription of a drug
A code that qualifies the copay amount
A fee charged for each prescription of a drug, expressed as a percentage of that drug's overall cost
A code that qualifies the coinsurance rate
